Subjective: Stress-related symptoms: muscle tension, palpitations, rapid breathing. Attributes to demanding job as new doctor. No chest pain, no dizziness. Sleep: 6 hours/night, difficulty falling asleep due to work worries. No abdominal complaints. Social: Lives with housemates (also doctors), good support system. Request: Rule out physical causes (e.g., anemia), seek professional counseling.
Objective: BP 120/60, HR 65, SpO2 98%, RR 14. Lungs: clear. Heart: normal sounds, no murmurs. No abdominal issues.
Assessment: Stress-related symptoms likely linked to occupational burnout. No somatic cause identified on physical exam. Ruled out: Anemia (pending blood test results).
Plan: 1. Blood tests: Hgb, thyroid, LFTs, KFTs. 2. Referral to mental health nurse. 3. Self-care advice: schedule relaxation activities, maintain regular sleep schedule. 4. Occupational health referral: discuss work conditions. 5. Safety net: follow-up if symptoms worsen or if blood tests indicate issues.
